review: I've had two Rokus, an Apple TV, and a Panasonic streaming Blu-ray player. This thing beats them all. The UI is fast and responsive, the voice search really works well, and the streaming startup times are much shorter on the same connection. Highly recommended if you're a cord-cutter like myself or you just want a box to stream your media from most of the big services in streaming.

author: Wayne Bliss

review: UPDATE: After 16 months my Fire TV gave out. If the first rep I talked to would have been honest and told me the Fire unit was out of warranty I would have simply bought a new one and been done with it.It took three weeks of non-committal answers in emails and phone calls to get a "refurbished" replacement that was broken and not "refurbished."I talked to almost a dozen people and after a mountain of emails and phone calls (one rep left me on hold for 30+ minutes) I was given a refund (though not what I wanted) and sent on my way. I was so disappointed in my treatment by Amazon - first by not telling me the truth up front and by the shabby treatment and defective replacement unit. I was angry enough to cancel my Prime membership and delete all my subscriptions. If you are going to buy a Fire TV - get the extended warranty because these units won't last more than a year.I found a better alternative - I purchased a Sony Blu-Ray/streaming player with a 4-year warranty from Best Buy for just a little more than what a Fire TV would cost. Almost 10 days ago I cancelled my Prime membership and have yet to receive a refund for either that or the defective unit. There's so much about Amazon that's good but when it's bad, it's spectacularly bad.For many reasons I decided to get rid of DirecTV but I still wanted to be able to use my Amazon Prime, Netflix and Hulu Plus. This device plugs in easily and work incredibly well. Switching between the different programs is easy, easy and I really like the voice activated feature. The one unexpected bonus are the lovely screen savers available when no program is playing. I love them! They are a soothing improvement to a blank TV screen when you would rather not have a program on. This product along with Amazon Prime (worth it even at $99 a year) is the perfect answer when getting rid of cable/dish networks. I'm very, very happy with this product.
